website_summaries.verdict: The coffee maker comes with a glass carafe and can be used with either whole beans or pre-ground coffee.
pros: Can be programmed up to 24 hours in advance
Can work reliably for many years
Customers tend to re-buy this product
cons: Not as nice of a grinder as models with burr grinders

customer_reviews.title: After looking at the great rating this had
customer_reviews.text: It is decent. After looking at the great rating this had, I figured it would be a great machine. One big downfall to this is the grinder. After one use, the steam rises into it making you have to clean AND dry before using it again. If not, the coffee grinds will stick to the container (see images). Also the coffee is a bit "weak" compared to our old coffee machine with a grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Hulk12Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee after 4 years of daily use!
customer_reviews.text: Sure, grinding is loud; sure, it is an unavoidable nuisance to clean the grinder, basket, and glass coffee pot after every use and refill it; but this coffee-maker is a winner. For the price, it function exceptionally well, and (unlike our Kerig, which only heats the water to 185 degrees), heats the water adequately to make very good coffee. We love being able to (very easily) set the coffee to go off at 4:00 am for our son's early morning shift--who can be awake enough at that hour to grind and brew fresh Joe?
customer_reviews.author: Blake Poleynard

customer_reviews.title: Coffee pot of anger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this replace my other cuisinart coffee maker. I hate this machine. It is messy, has to have beans added daily, where my other machine would hold several days worth, and you can’t make 12 full cups with the amount of beans the grinder holds. The other major flaw is you have to guess on the amount of beans to put in. You can’t fill up the bean bin and then make a small amount of coffee. It grinds all of the beans. This coffee pot disappoints me daily and I’m hoping Santa brings me my old cuisinart back. Wish I’d paid more attention before ordering. Thought I was getting the one I had previously and loved.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and makes a great cup of coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as advertised. Cleaning is a snap and for the few seconds it takes to clean it, it's more than worth it for the end product. Which is a great cup of coffee. the only downside I would say is the grinder is a little noisy but nothing that is unbearable, really more nitpicking than anything. I bought a stainless steel thermal carafe 12 cup that fits in place of the glass carafe, but the glass carafe is a very nice spill proof spout that does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cweed

customer_reviews.title: High maintenance
customer_reviews.text: It brews a fine cup of coffee. I bought mine at least 3 years ago and it's still going strong. My biggest criticism is that you have 6 parts to wash between each use. I bought this machine thinking it would be more efficient to grind and brew all in one machine. But the cleaning cancels out any time you saved. It requires filter replacements adding long term costs. I just started pouring filtered water directly in there.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Brewer/Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd one of this brand coffee maker, they last 3 to 4 years with making coffee from fresh ground beans everyday. I like this brand because they are easy to use and clean and they make excellent coffee. Mine is set for morning time brew and it is always ready when i am up for morning coffee.For the price of this unit, i can afford to replace them 3 to 4 years later. Will continue to use this brand coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: feels like it would decrease the functionality of the machine overtime
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews on the steam getting into the grinder and wished I paid attention, I assumed that Cuisinart was aware of customer reviews and must've fixed the glitch, but no! facing the same problem. It's hard to clean esp inside the machine in the area where the grinder shoots into the filter. That issue along with steam getting into the grinder with every use, feels like it would decrease the functionality of the machine overtime. Yes reasonable price but still would've expected that Cuisinart fixed these glitches. I use this on a daily basis, sometimes twice so In the future I would spend more money for a smoother working machine, and advise future buyers to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Malak

customer_reviews.title: This is my second purchase of this coffee maker, the other was worn out
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about the cussinart coffee grind and brew machine. The first one held up for about 12 years and I hated to see it go. But like all things good, they end. So, I bought a new one and thus far am very pleased with the performance and quality it produces. I do miss the stainless steel coffee pot though, I prone to break things.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 month - steady decline in Cuisinart quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of Cuisinart Grind-and-Brew has steadily declined. We bought this model in 2012 and it lasted 6+ years. We replaced it with model 550 BK which lasted 18 months. We went back to this model and it lasted 1 month. Warmer burnt out filling house with acrid burning plastic smell. Amazon did not initially accept this return but relented after contacting them.
customer_reviews.author: bikergirl

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy customer
customer_reviews.text: The lid and the grinder stays wet all the time and it is a mess to clean up because you have to take each part off and too much moisture stays in the grinder after each use. It is a very easy way for mold to form if you just leave it wet all the time from condensation. Even if you never use the grinder, it stays very wet from condensation. So we are very dissatisfied with this product. Too much money for such a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Buffi

customer_reviews.title: Grinder stays on
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product and it was delivered on 8/20/20. Today, 9/9/20 the grinder was stuck on. Unplugged hoping to reset it, still stuck on grinding. Try a different outlet? No luck. Hit a random combination of buttons? Tried that too. So, for the price I paid per cup of coffee before this machine was rendered useless I could have gotten Starbucks every day instead. I do not recommend this investment.
customer_reviews.author: Steele Mag

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker. The grinder is pretty loud, but you get used to it. Coffee comes out nice and never burned. I love that I can program it the night before and have fresh coffee in the morning. The only downside is that the only way to control cup brew quantity is by the amount of cups of water you put into the water chamber. It would be nice to be able to fill up the chamber and select amount of cups to be brewed from the setting so that you don't have to fill up the water camber every time you make coffee.
customer_reviews.author: LifeIsNatty

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup of coffee. Two slight design flaws involving the built-in grinder: 1. The steam from the coffee pot will sludge up the powder residue left in the grinder. This means you have wash it every time or every other time, somewhat countering the convenience of having built-in grinder. 2. If you fill up the grinder completely and fill the pot to the max 12 cups, you end up with a weak pot of coffee. This means you would have to either use pre-ground coffee, have another grinder, or run the grinder without water in the maker, refill the grinder, then run the grinder again with water in. Again, only slightly inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Smoke coming from cord 2 months later
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 months, this machine began smoking and stopped working. The smoke was coming from the cord area. The coffee brewed, and as it was dripping into the pot, the SMOKE began pouring out of the cord area and the machine DID shut down. FORTUNATELY! I opened the door and window to air out the house. I’m very disappointed - the cuisinart coffee maker before this one lasted 15 years. This one, less than 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Nicki Forde

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee. Careful with the glass.
customer_reviews.text: I settled for this coffee maker after looking at the Braville, which I would prefer. This one seems flimsy and not built to last. The glass carafe is thin and feels like an eggshell. Over all the unit works fine, brews a nice cup of coffee. Hopefully it will last longer then the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Nerf Herder

customer_reviews.title: The coffee brews flavorful and quickly.
customer_reviews.text: We love the automatic grinder. That makes it much simpler to use. Cleaning is quick and easy for us. The coffee brews up deliciously. We had purchased another brand a few months ago through Amazon and it quit working shortly after the 90 day warranty. The company absolutely ignored our calls and emails. Cuisinart already works so much better and their warranty is much better also. I don't anticipate any problems with the coffee pot. Cuisinart has a good reputation for good appliances and customer service. We are glad we made this decision.
customer_reviews.author: Mcrindy

customer_reviews.title: If you like to grind your own beans....
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a coffee maker that: grinds beans and also uses regular coffee. I had a Keurig, very expensive model to say the least, and when it began depositing grounds in the bottom of my cup, that was it. A girlfriend of mine suggested your product and I'm VERY glad I opted to purchase it. I now look forward to every morning to having a cup of coffee WITHOUT COFFEE GROUNDS in the bottom of my cup - and when I use the "grinding" options, my coffee is "DELICIOUS" :)
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: A freshly ground and brewed pot of coffee every morning
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my husband as a gift. He always likes the smell of freshly ground coffee beans. He and I are both in love with this Cuisinart coffee grinder / brewer. The Simplicity of it is amazing. We simply load up the beans and water the night before and the next morning we awake to a freshly ground and brewed pot of coffee. It is a little noisey but not too loud. It is also pretty easy to clean. I would highly recommend this Appliance.
customer_reviews.author: E. Keck

customer_reviews.title: having a good cup of strong coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd Cuisinart Grind-and-Brew and working well. However had some problems with previous ones such as quitting half way through brewing only to find applying pressure on lid it finishes brewing. Overall works great with price we paid for it and last one lasted 5 years and still working (with the pressure thing) and will serve as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary M Holman

customer_reviews.title: Works great; lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.text: 1. It makes a great pot of coffee. 2. It keeps the pot at optimum temperature for up to two hours. 3. It is much easier to keep clean than the more complex DGB-700BC maker. 4. The user is in complete control over the strength of the coffee. The timer in the DGB-700BC works OK, but it is not as consistent. 5. It's about half the price of the DGB-700BC. 6. I always use disposable paper filters, so I can't comment on the wire mesh filter that comes with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: T Hull

customer_reviews.title: Two uses then dead
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big fan of Cuisinart coffee machines for years, especially the grind a brew models. I've had various models for 15 years. This particular machine however is a failure in my book. On the 2nd use of this machine, electrical smoke started coming from around the rubber grommet where the power cord enters the back of the machine. I obviously am returning it and will be looking for a different model/brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gee, did we forget to mention, it's not conical type of grinder ,it's a blade
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of Cuisinart because they are over priced and not as durable as they think they are. I took a chance because I know that Amazon will back me up.However , this works well if your not expecting a conical type of grinder ,it's a blade. Whom ever wrote the description left it out. I might have not bought it but the blade is sufficient for my need. That's why I gave it a 4 stars.The conical is $150 and not worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Esstk

customer_reviews.title: Meh... Pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is a pain in the neck to clean, I wish I had not bought this model. When my old Cuinsinart coffee maker bit the dust, I thought it would be a good thing to combine 2 functions into one. Not so. It's clumsy to use and a big disappointment. In good conscience, I can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Long Beach Lovely

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Customer-**Update**
customer_reviews.text: This is a pile of junk. Do not buy this product. I bought this item in December 2019 and now the grinder will not shut off after grinding beans. I didn’t even use it every day. I maybe got 40-days use. Very disappointed **UPDATE** I contacted Cuisinart customer service and dealt with a very nice person regarding my failed purchase. Customer Rep gave me a pathway to return my purchase for a full replacement coffeemaker with not cost me. Before I could the requested items returned Cuisinart, customer service sent me a full replacement coffeemaker. Although the coffeemaker failed, customer service made the purchase right. Thank you Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Moore

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I love coffee. I enjoy my cup in the morning as part of my routine. The timer is very nice and easy to use. BUT the coffee-making function is below average... the water trajectory must be ill-designed or not manufactured well because a typical amount of coffee (grounds or whole beans) will give you brown water - not coffee. I have tried changing coffee grinds, water temp, etc. I will discard this product.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent with dropping ground whole bean grounds into basket.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't consistently put grounds into basket when using whole bean grinder, and this happened just a month into use. So I went back to using separate grinder. This unit also wants cleaning time by saying you have to rinse everything after each use. The grinder container builds up after every grind, why is that? I tried to clean after each use, but the buildup continued. I am sorry I purchased this item as doesn't live up to my expectations for this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer 13

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this machine and it arrived last night. I carefully went through and followed all the prep instructions getting the machine ready for its first grind and brew this morning. The coffee seems fine but it is really loud. There have got to be quieter models out there. I know that on the one in the clubroom in our apartment building, you can't even hear the beans grinding though you see the level of the beans go down. I also did not research thoroughly enough and didn't realise that you can only put enough beans in for a single use. Cleaning the whole system after every use is a pain. More research is required.
customer_reviews.author: Universal Beth

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pieces to clean, particularly when one uses the grinder feature.
customer_reviews.text: Used for typical household coffee making. I like the flavor, brew time and having the grinder being organic to the coffee maker. Only thing that is any detractor at all, and very minor at that, is cleaning the unit after using the grinder to make a pot.
customer_reviews.author: GLF

customer_reviews.title: ONLY OK
customer_reviews.text: Its ok not much better than cheaper brands I've had in the past - very fresh beans with higher oil content will stick to the sides of the grinder and not grind at all - so I throw a few beans every pot into the trash --- The area to pour the water is small so best to fill when your not in a hurry or sleepy because there is little room for error - I don't think I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise33

customer_reviews.title: High Maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee but if you buy this coffee maker just know that your new full-time job is cleaning this thing. If you grind the beans then you have to clean the grinder every single time you use it. I've tried not cleaning it a couple of times but then all beans don't get ground. The problem with this coffee maker is that the grinder gets moist from the steam of the coffee being made and what's left is the residue that needs to be cleaned with each use. What a terrible design! The coffee is good so I keep using it but I resent it a little more each time. 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Laura E. Onorato

customer_reviews.title: Extra Work
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker is a bit of a disappointment. It's actually my third Cuisinart grind and brew, and it's the first one to give me trouble right out of the gate. Condensation builds up inside the grinder each time, so there's always a large chunk of unground beans stuck to the lid. If you carefully clean and dry every single piece after every single cycle, you minimize the amount of beans "lost," but that hardly makes it a convenient appliance for someone who drinks coffee every day. Otherwise, it's fine. Coffee is nice and hot, easy to program, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and prone to break.
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this machine, plan on cleaning it constantly (coffee gets clogged in the grinder) and replacing the unit. Replacement parts are difficult (sometimes impossible) to find.
customer_reviews.author: The Maj

customer_reviews.title: Input too high
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the quantity of beans required to brew a cup of coffee that differs in flavor from water is...well I wouldn’t know. I couldn’t get there. I returned to just grinding beans separately and using a basic coffee pot. I love the idea, though.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Ended up not using the grinding function...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice design and brews great coffee. Easy to set and operate. The only draw back I've found is that the grind chamber must be cleaned between each brew. I was expecting more of a storage chamber that pulls the beans out to be ground each day. This is not the case. You have to replace the beans every day and after brewing, the grind chamber gets wet and needs to be cleaned. We ended up just using our external coffee grinder. Not ideal, but still a really great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: RBull013

customer_reviews.title: Self-Destructed in 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Only had this 3 weeks before it completely self-destructed. It started grinding ceaselessly as soon as it was plugged in and the power button wouldn’t turn it off. I attempted to let it finish a brew cycle, but within a minute or so, the grinder burnt out and the heating element got so hot it burnt itself loose and I yanked the plug. Long wait on hold with Cuisinart to get it replaced... we’ll see how long it’s successor lasts...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes good coffee as a basic coffee maker using ground beans. The grinder doesn’t fit enough beans to make a strong enough pot of coffee, which makes it pretty useless in my home. I am also concerned about the cleanliness. The entire grinder has to be in place at all times for brewing, whether grinding or not. The cavity that the grinder fits into isn’t easy to clean and gets gross.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was excited about the built-in Grind feature and wanted to love this. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Cuisinart coffee pot purchase. I was excited about the built-in Grind feature and wanted to love this. Unfortunately, our brewed coffee tasted like plastic forever. We returned it and went with Cuisinart Brew Central DCC-1200 12 Cup which we love.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke A. Slabic

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes great coffee and is easy to use. Just keep in mind that it doesn't have a burr grinder and that you have to clean the grinder every time you use it as opposed to other units that don't require daily grinder cleaning. However, cleaning the machine is a snap so it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: IJC

customer_reviews.title: Does not grind well
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase this product again. The grinder does not fully grind the beans, clogging the machine; somehow, moisture gets into the bean portal, which is probably why they don't fully grind; and the alarm clock does not work properly. Unfortunately, I missed returning this product to Amazon by a few days. I contacted the manufacturer, approximately 5 days ago, and have not heard anything to date. I would like a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Ground Beans Every Day!
customer_reviews.text: I love Cuisinart's Grind-and-Brew Coffeemakers, although I find they need to be replaced about every 18 months. This is my first time with the glass carafe, which requires the heating element remain on and the coffee gets a little too "cooked" if I linger. I usually purchase the stainless carafe, but it was not available so I settled. This takes care of business, but is not my favorite of the models.
customer_reviews.author: Pecca

customer_reviews.title: This is getting pretty expensive and we re going to look for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our third cuisinart grind n brew coffeemaker. This one started malfunctioning after three months, it would only brew partial pots then would shut off. we replaced our second Grind n brew for doing this same thing after 2 1/2 years of service. Cost additional $40.00 to get it replaced during our one year warranty period. This is getting pretty expensive and we re going to look for a different brand. Cuisinart just isn't what it used to be. We also had the carafe in this model without warmer. Unless you drink the entire pot immediately you're going to be sipping cool coffee all day
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: This Beats a "Pod" Every Day of the Week
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the 4th or 5th one of these I've bought over the years. Guests always rave about how great the coffee is at my house. This coffee pot is a big reason why. There's NOTHING like fresh ground coffee to make an impression. Works every time.
customer_reviews.author: TexasMJo

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: COULD be a wonderful coffee maker---if it worked. The first one I got was from a 3rd party and cheaper. I should know better. It was missing parts and didn't work well. Second one. Seemed fine now all of a sudden it won't keep the warming plate on for set time. You also need to completely clean all parts every time as coffee grounds from grinder seem to get everywhere. AND the grinder is extremely loud and seems to go far longer than necessary. I'm returning my second one.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: It does work nice and smooth however
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of steps to making coffee here with this machine. Clean out where the beans go which is in two parts, clean out the filter section which has three parts to it, then rince out the carafe and pour in the water. The one thing that I really didn't care for is you cannot adjust the grind, you just push a button to grind and that is it unless there is something I don't know. Also you cannot put enough beans in to make 12 cups on this machine. 10 is all it can really make. It does work nice and smooth however.
customer_reviews.author: NJY

customer_reviews.title: made very weak coffee after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: this coffee maker worked brilliantly for a few weeks, and in the last three weeks has begun to brew very very weak coffee. upon closer inspection, it appears that the water is only going through half of the grinds, resulting in sea through barely brown coffee. we have wasted a lot of coffee troubleshooting and are extremely disappointed. waiting for amazon's response now...am guessing we will have to deal with cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry E Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: and added the the thermal carafe that goes with the 10 cup it was great being able to get replacement thru amazon quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have owed this coffee maker for many years, have replace broken carafes, and added the the thermal carafe that goes with the 10 cup it was great being able to get replacement thru amazon quickly. We have always liked the coffee and the grinder. Researching in prior to buying I found that a perfect grind and brew was not available. Now I am looking for a new grinder top, mine has actual worn through from ware and $30 vs buy a new pot since this is quite old leaves me wondering what is the difference between the 625 and the 550? until I decide I guess I will repair the grinder with electrical tape and keep grinding
customer_reviews.author: M. F.

customer_reviews.title: It has never made a good cup of coffee when using the directions provided
customer_reviews.text: It has never made a good cup of coffee when using the directions provided. I adjusted the amount of water to 10 cups instead of 12 and added the maximum of coffee grounds and then it's adequate. We don't drink our coffee strong, but don't want it like tea either. Now that I'm 3 days past eligibility for return, the water is only passing through half the grounds and the coffee is not drinkable -- tried making two pots with the same problem. I paid more because it was a Cuisinart and am beyond disappointed. Guess I'm out $72.00 because it doesn't look like I have a recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Debra L. Smitt

customer_reviews.title: Caught on fire...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the coffee while it worked. Cought on fire. Luckily i was there waiting for the coffee to be made. Coffee was done brewing, put the pot back on the hot plate and it just started smoking and popping and it smelled like burning plastic. Unplugged the machine and it smoldered for a good 15 minutes outside with smoke pouring out of it. I had a house full of people too. Thank god nothing happened...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Left the Cuisinart brand for a Keurig a few years back. After Keurig fizzled out completely came back to the grind and brew. Love the programmable feature, fresh coffee being ground is the perfect secondary alarm clock. Carafe could keep coffee a little bit hotter but that is personal preference I prefer a steaming cup of coffee. Hopper for the coffee beans is easily removable and hand-washable, the permanent filter is a perfect touch and saves on purchasing paper coffee filters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad engineering
customer_reviews.text: The design of this grinding coffee maker is flawed somehow. It grinds the coffee and sends to the basket, but hot water only hits part of the grounds, resulting in weak coffee. But also doesn’t hold enough grounds or beans to make 10 cups of normal strength coffee.
customer_reviews.author: karhan

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee with caveats.
customer_reviews.text: Makes super coffee, all parts must be thoroughly washed and DRIED to assure coffee quality. The little tang on the Grinder Basket Lid snapped off today {4 months of daily use}, it still works as long as I put the tang into it's respective slot so that the switch is engaged. This tang was obviously engineered to break. It works so not going to worry about contacting CVS over it. I will not replace this pot with the same one when it is no longer useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Owned pot for 6 months now....Crappy-nart
customer_reviews.text: Crap. I bought this in December 2013 and it is June 2014....6 months into owning this coffeemaker, use it every morning.The top lid has warped and does not seat properly. Everytime we make coffee, the alarm goes off and the pot stops brewing. The last Cusinart coffeemaker we owned lasted 7 years without incident. This one is a disapointment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gordon’s Bass

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coffee Maker until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice coffee maker however it is not bushed metal as the description states. It is plastic that looks like brushed metal. This is the reason I only gave it 4 stars. Other than that it is nice to have the coffee beans grind just before the pot brews. UPDATE 5/16/12 My coffeemaker will no longer brew. It started about 2 weeks ago brewing very slow now has completly stopped. What a shame to spend this amount of money to have it only last 9 months. Looking back at other reviews, this seems to be a problem with this maker. I am changing my 4 stars to 1 and I don't recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bargnhuntr

customer_reviews.title: We are so disappointed in this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: We are so disappointed in this coffee maker, we have tried everything to get it to make dark coffee from having the pot grind beans to putting the grounds in the basket and nothing works. It consistently make weak colored looking tea for the best description. And drinking it is like drinking creamer w/ hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Last for years
customer_reviews.text: I've had this coffee maker for over 5 years and it works great. Only have had to replace two parts, but expected wear and tear with daily use. Never need to buy filters since it comes with a reusable filter that works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This will grind whole bean as it is made for the freshest coffee. This can also use ground coffee for versatility. We go through a lot of coffee. Our last one (same model) lasted a long time and finally wore out. I was happy to find that I could buy the same model again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sutterfield

customer_reviews.title: A pain to clean! Doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a coffee make with a bean grinder. It makes a good cup of coffee but there are so many parts to clean. Moisture gets into the grinder piece so you have to pull that out and clean before each use. We've also only had for a year and it takes an hour to brew a pot of coffee. I've tried cleaning with vinegar and that hasn't helped. It will brew for a few minutes and then beep indicating it's done brewing when it's not.
customer_reviews.author: Mlss0

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. The grinder holds approximately 4 tablespoons and spits out whole beans. The assembly gathers moisture into the grinder and is impossible to clean. The filter basket has a difficult lid that will ruin a pot of coffee is improperly placed. I have a master's degree and wasn't able to figure out how to program it even once (and neither were my college educated roommates). MOST IMPORTANT is that Conair, which owns Cuisinart, will not stand by this product and will not take back this poorly engineered device. You bought it, you keep it. There's a reason it's $60 now instead of the $80 I paid for it two months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love these! This is my 4th one. I use them a lot, and wear them out. I get about 5 years use out of each one before warmer goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Vince S.

customer_reviews.title: Like grind and brews
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd one. They don't last but a couple years, but it's awesome having fresh ground coffee every morning
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed, inconvenient due to condensation in grinder
customer_reviews.text: Makes good tasting coffee but it’s an incredible pain to use because you have to take apart the grinder and basket after every use and deep clean them. It’s poorly designed so the steam makes condensation within the grinder so it builds up ground coffee very easily. Wish we could give this more stars, but it really falls short for overall convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine. Well built and GOOD coffee
customer_reviews.text: Nice machine. Well built and GOOD coffee. The only VERY SMALL complaint I have is that the grinder must remain in the machine, and therefore must be cleaned, even if you use pre-ground coffee.Its really no big deal at all. Just an observation. Youll likely use the grinder each time anyway... the coffee tastes better.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo5000

customer_reviews.title: There is another more expensive model which is a burr grinder which is probably a much better brewer. The blade grinder does not
customer_reviews.text: This is a blade grinder. There is another more expensive model which is a burr grinder which is probably a much better brewer. The blade grinder does not extract as much flavor and burns the beans while grinding.. 20141119 Update: downgraded. it just doesn't make good coffee. If you like brown water, you might like this product; steer clear if you like real coffee.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaDude

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I called customer service and i was on hold for 35 minutes, i gave up and called the next day when they claimed to open, and every option was a recording, then it told me all service representatives are busy, and the wait time will be longer than 15 minutes. I cant seen to get an answer from anyone via email or phone about a defective product. We have had our for less than one year and the heating coils have broken. the top lid was made of such thin plastic that it warped from the steam and will not close. I am trying to get it replaced via warranty but i cannot get an answer.
customer_reviews.author: JJWall

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Fall Apart - Don't Buy It. No wonder I've seen so many donated to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart, fall apart. Totally defective product. The door housing the filter does not stay shut while its brewing. The door swings open while hot water is dripping out of the machine into the filter. Every morning there is coffee and water all over my counters, the door with the filter is wide open and all I get is a huge mess. Cuisinart customer service sucks too. Do not buy Cuisinart, it will fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Rosierose14

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: We owned the old Cuisinart Grind & Brew for several years of good consistent coffee. So when it died, we looked for another Cuisinart but could not find one in our price range, in a weak moment bought a Mr. Coffee, no grind, less parts to clean. Was not impressed, took it back, found Cuisinart DGB-625BC at Amazon and welcomed back and old friend. Just to mention a few points: Quality of construction, excellent, even the carafe glass thickness feels substantial, especially compared to Mr. Coffee. The brewing temperature enhances the taste of the coffee, which is excellent.The grind noise is still a good alarm clock for whomever is still sleeping nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Nomadscuba

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this coffee maker. We bought it for the coffee grinder feature. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Pilblad

customer_reviews.title: Base warming plate clicks constantly
customer_reviews.text: I returned one unit because I thought it was defective. The base warming plate clicks randomly loudly all the time the warmer is on and is very annoying. I did a little google research and it says this could possibly be a wiring defect. I received a new one from Amazon and guess what this one does it too. Going to see how it does through the Christmas season and if it is not better i'm going to return this one too. Anyone else had this problem? Other than the fact that the grinding mechanism needs to be cleaned well after each brew I am please with this coffee pot.
customer_reviews.author: Nibby Priest

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 12 cup coffee maker with a glass pot. I received a 10 cup different coffee maker with a metal pot. The box was falling apart and there were old coffee beans inside the maker. I understood there would definitely be wear and tear because it was used. But it wasn’t even cleaned. This is exactly why I wanted a glass coffee pot. I would like to return for my money back please.
customer_reviews.author: Danal Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart DGB-625BC Grind and Brew 12 Cup
customer_reviews.text: Really love it. First Cuisinart maker was also 12 cup with the metal thermos to collect coffee. This model is preferable to me. Easier to clean. Can always see amount of coffee left. Stays hot enough long enough. Thermal container hard to keep clean after a while.. compromised taste of coffee & container much more expensive to replace. Glad I opted for this model. Many times I only make 10 or less cups. Has coffee grind feature which I use a lot but not always. Allows you to pour yourself a cup before entire process is completed. Easy to use and clean . Directions easy to follow...well diagrammed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: We have had several Cuisinart grind and brew coffee makers now. This one lasted 2.5 months before it totally stoped BOTH grinding and brewing. Extremely didappointing. It was more of a hassle to use compared to older models, but I decided it was worth it if it lasted longer. No such luck. I would give it zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Sally A. Horvathm

customer_reviews.title: needing a new one
customer_reviews.text: our old one leaked water so not sure why. glad I found this on sale thank you
customer_reviews.author: Audrey L Hartsell

customer_reviews.title: Better the second time around
customer_reviews.text: This is my second machine from Cuisinart. The first Grind and Brew was a gift from a friend. She had used it for a short while. When it started to slow down, I retired it and purchased this new grind and brew. I do love it. It is easy and brews delicious coffee no matter how you brew, beans or pre-ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my first coffee maker, that grinds the beans, I've ever had. Finally, I can make a good cup of coffee. While this coffee maker takes both beans and ground coffee, there is a distict (better) difference when the coffe is made by grinding the beans. The functionality is direct and simple. The coffee stays hot after brewing. I would have given it 5 stars except for the poping and sizzeling noise made by the unit while the caraf is on the warming plate. I kept going back to the unit looking for somthing wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great cup of coffee. I love the option to grind my own beans or use pre-ground
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like the Blue Angels taking off...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot is super loud when it grinds the coffee beans. We have had this machine for about a month. We preprogrammed for the coffee to be made at 5am. Every morning when the grinder turns on we wake up with a jolt because our bedroom is right off the kitchen. This is by far the loudest coffee pot and I find it very unusual that I have not seen another review stating the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty nice machine
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty nice machine, and YES...cleaning of the grinding unit is required after every use(or before ever use) and a thorough drying is paramount. Grinder is fairly cheesy and not a burr grinder, but for the price point I wasn't expecting a burr grinder...just hopeful lol. Overall makes a great cup of Joe
customer_reviews.author: Briand

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee pot! easy to program and the vacuum for the grinder sucks every thing that was ground into the filter for the coffee. very easy to clean for next use. ( multiple pieces but not a big deal to clean) I had bought a separate electric grinder for my previous coffee pot but it didn't grind as fine as the Cuisinart, and was much more of a hassle to use. Very happy with this pot! it brews a very good pot of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: J. Persons

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent grind that won't adjust
customer_reviews.text: I *Love* my coffee so the machine is very important to me. Yes, this has some nice features, but that matters little when I cannot predict the strength of the coffee I'm going to get. Most mornings I find whole beans still in the grinder with a pretty coarse grind on a 4-6 cup setting. I can't get my coffee strong enough for my tastes without a huge waste of money. When you drink premium coffees like Starbucks, this gets expensive fast.
customer_reviews.author: mbn

customer_reviews.title: A little frustrating to use on a daily basis
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker makes a very good cuppa coffee; whatever, i'm getting very tired of cleaning up the coffee grinder on a daily basis. Due to the design, moisture will find its way into the grinder during the brew. If you don't mind the hassle of cleaning on a daily basis, don't shy away from this product. If you're not a patient person, you may want to consider a pod coffeemaker (or such).
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This little Cuisinart is wonderful & just keep chugging along
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 2 other grind/brew coffee pots that quit working. This little Cuisinart is wonderful & just keep chugging along. It didn't make the coffee as strong as I like, so I don't fill it up all the way with water. Then when that pot is done, I just add more coffee beans & make a little more. It does take a little more effort to clean every day, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sally J. Bacus

customer_reviews.title: This Cuisinart Grind-and-brew coffee maker ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: had our original grind-and-brew over 7 years without any issues but it began turning off on us. We bought this replacement at a superb price and hit the ground running. This is a great option for a grind-and-brew for under $80. The only thing that would make this more incredible would be a thermal carafe...but it's still excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco E. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Stays hot. Not too hard to clean. Looks nice. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid all in one coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. I had to replace the filter with one with a solid bottom. The filter that comes with the machine has a filter bottom; consequently the water falls straight through it and the coffee is very weak. However, I replaced the filter the coffee was much better. Steam tends to get up in the grinder which makes cleaning a bit of an effort but not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Will Caskey

customer_reviews.title: Solid coffee maker but does not brew piping hot coffee or strong coffee
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee maker for lovers of medium strength coffee. It has one grind and not a huge grinder vessel. Unfortunately, it does not make strong coffee that I like. I cannot rate it badly because it does exactly what it is designed to, very well. Also, temperature is not as hot as other Cuisinart's.
customer_reviews.author: mia

customer_reviews.title: I loved the way it brews coffee but the condensation of ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the way it brews coffee but the condensation of steam over the grinder when it's not in use is annoying. The grinder can be a challenge to reload into the machine when you want to grind and brew. Steam seems to have gotten into the display on two of these that I have owned, causing the display (which is difficult to read when it is new) to burn out some of the bars. After the second one in less than 18 months I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dryden

customer_reviews.title: That's the worst possible thing I can think of
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I can think of is that there isn't a battery to remember the time in case the power goes out or I want to unplug the coffee maker during the day to conserve energy. That's the worst possible thing I can think of. Beyond that, this coffee mill and maker is perfectly and intuitively engineered so that it's easy to maintain and makes, truly, a perfect pot (or cup) of coffee. I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not like this machine at all
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this machine at all. Cuisinart used to make quality products now they are just cheap plastic outsourced offshore. This unit requires you to take out the grinding bean cavity and clean after each use. This is cumbersome and inefficient. Worth it to pay extra to avoid this hassle unless you enjoy playing the game of this part attaches to that part every time you make a cup of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Tellya Later

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far do good. We’ve only had it for less than a month
customer_reviews.author: sfg

customer_reviews.title: The Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: We used this product at a "vacation home" for seven days this Thanksgiving. I never thought grinding your own coffee could enhance the flavor..we were wrong. The coffeemaker was wonderful. When we returned home, we purchased one through Amazon.com and love grinding our own coffee, then brewing like we did at Thanksgiving. I will not go back to buying pre-ground coffee beans again. Using it every morning and just LOVE it. What a way to start a morning!! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: A little louder than what we had previously, but that’s what happens when it’s grinding coffee beans for each pot. Dependable
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: cleaning is quick but a hassle
customer_reviews.text: the cleaning is quick, the parts are easy to take off. the programmer is easy to set. the reason i give it a 4 star rather than a 5star is because you have to do the prep every time. I was hoping to dump in a bag of bean and then allow the grinder to automatically brew however many cup i want, but nope, if that's what you're looking for- this is not it. other than that its nice having freshly ground brew in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: EvenKeel

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee and bean grinding in one well built, easy to use unit
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker (my 3rd one). I have also had the version with the stainless pot but I like this one better since it keeps the coffee much hotter. Its a little harder to clean then a traditional coffee maker because of the built in grinder, but its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ulm

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a Cuisanart!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 2 1/2 months and it burned up! Started making an awful popping noise, and when I checked on it, there was smoke coming from the hot plate and out of the back of the machine by the cord. Thankfully I was there and was able to unplug it and rush it out the door before it flamed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Not the best machine as I couldn't get the grinder to consistently ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the best machine as I couldn't get the grinder to consistently work. Plus the flavor of the coffee was not great. I used the basket that it came with. Had to return it and swapped it out with the Bodum BISTRO coffee maker which is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Dashriprocket

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Grind and Brew
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second Grind and Brew and am ready to purchase a spare. I love this product. I clean it each night before bed, fill with water and beans, and set the timer. I had my first one for a few years, and have had this one for about 4 years. I like strong coffee, and when I use the correct amount of beans I get it! I have definitely gotten my money's worth out of this pot.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: I love grind & brew coffee machines for the aroma of ...
customer_reviews.text: I love grind & brew coffee machines for the aroma of the ground beans, the ease brewing and cleaning it. We have purchased this type of brewer from Cuisinart for years now and wouldn't trade it. K-Cups are great if you are a one cup coffee drinker but for an addict like me, I need a pot and sometimes I share with my husband too.
customer_reviews.author: Robinegg

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst, most inconsistent coffee maker I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst, most inconsistent coffee maker I've ever had. Sometimes it's like the water never even passes through the coffee grounds - after brewing the water was barely brown, and the center of the grounds was actually dry. The machine somehow added a metallic flavor to coffee that I could not get rid of. No matter how many washes and clean cycles coffee didn't taste like coffee. How does a coffee machine totally screw up the one job it has?
customer_reviews.author: PMac

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I really love this coffee maker. It's easy to clean and brews wonderful coffee. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for your first grinder-coffee maker. It's easy to make coffee with pre-ground beans or whole beans. You can just turn off the grinder. It's also easy to program. Price is right too. I looked a long time before I found this one and bought it because someone recommended it to me. it delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Exercise Gal

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and popping noise
customer_reviews.text: Love it but really noisy and it sounds like a popcorn making towards the middle of it brewing you heard popping noise none of my coffee makers every made that noise
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Cuisinart DGB-625BC Grind-and-Brew 12-Cup Automatic Coffeemaker, Brushed Metal
product_meta.description:
Style:Glass| Size:12-Cup

GRIND AND BREW COFFEEMAKER
Retire your alarm clock and wake up instead to the rich aroma of freshly ground, just brewed coffee, with the Cuisinart Grind & Brew Automatic Coffeemaker. This deluxe 12-cup model offers the best of Cuisinart's expert coffeemaking technology to deliver unsurpassed ease of use and rich full-bodied coffee flavor. With streamlined European styling and a graceful carafe, it's a beautiful addition to any kitchen.

A perfect addition to any modern kitchen, this 12-cup automatic coffeemaker grinds whole beans right before brewing to produce a fresh and flavorful pot of coffee. Its 24-hour full programmability means the unit can be set for "wake-up" coffee or for having coffee ready when it's time to serve dessert--without having to get up from the table. In addition, its brew-pause function makes it possible to sneak a cup before the end of the brewing cycle. 

The Grind & Brew Coffeemaker features a separate grinding assembly and filter chamber to make beans easy to add and used grounds easy to remove. A convenient "grind off" control turns the grinder off when preground coffee is used. 

Smaller amounts can be brewed without any loss of flavor thanks to the units 1- to 4-cup setting. For added convenience, the coffeemaker provides a large control panel, adjustable automatic shut-off from zero to four hours, and a 12-cup (5 ounces each) glass carafe with a generous stay-cool handle and drip-free pouring spout. 

Accessories include a gold-tone commercial-style permanent filter and a charcoal water filter for removing impurities. The sleek-looking coffeemaker measures 12 by 9-4/5 by 17-1/2 inches and carries a three-year limited warranty.

A charcoal water filter and a permanent commercial-style gold tone coffee filter allow only pure flavor to flow through, and the popular Brew Pause feature lets you sneak a cup before the cycle is finished. 

PRODUCT PARTS AND BENEFITS
 1.  Reservoir Cover with Release Button
     Flips back for easy filling of the water reservoir and access to the grinder compartment. 
     
     
 2.  Showerhead (not shown) 
     Distributes water evenly over coffee, reducing temperature loss as water passes through grounds. 
     
     
 3.   
 4.  Control Panel
     
     
      * Clock/LCD Display
        Displays time of day and Auto On times. 
      * On/Off button with LED Indicator
        Manually turns coffeemaker on or off. 
      * Audible Tone
        An audible tone sounds 5 times when brew cycle is complete. 
      * 1-4 Cup Setting
        Improves extraction, flavor and temperature when brewing fewer than 5 cups. 
      * Hour and Minute Buttons
        Use to program clock and Auto On function. 
      * Grind Off Button with LED Indicator
        Turns off the grinder when using pre-ground coffee. 
      * Program Button with LED Indicator
        Sets and/or displays programmed Auto On time. 
     
     
     
     
 5.   
 6.  Filter Basket Compartment
     
     
      * Filter Basket
      * Filter Basket Cover
      * Cuisinart Gold Tone Commercial (Dishwasher Safe)
      * Style Filter
     
     
     
     
 7.  Filter Basket Door
     
     
 8.  Filter Basket Door Release Button
     
     
 9.  Brew Pause
     Stops flow of coffee from basket when carafe is removed (20 seconds max) from resting plate, so a cup can be poured in mid-brew, if desired. 
     
     
 10. Measuring Scoop with Brush
     
     
 11. Carafe
     The easy-pour, dripless, 12-cup carafe has an ergonomic handle and brewed coffee markings for two to twelve cups. 
     
     

 10.  Cord Storage
     
     
 11. Warming Plate
     Scratch resistant with nonstick coating. 
     
     
 12. #4 Basket Paper Filters included
     
     
 13. Water Reservoir with Water Level Indicator
     
     
 14. Charcoal Water Filter
     Charcoal water filter eliminates chlorine, bad tastes and odors from tap water. 
     
     
 15. BPA Free
     All materials that come in contact with coffee or water are BPA free. 
     
     
 16.  Grinder Basket Lid
     Use the recess on each side of the lid to remove lid for easy addition of beans. Note: Lid must be in place for unit to operate. 
     
     
 17. Grinder Basket
     
     


SPECIAL FEATURES


 * Automatically grinds whole beans before brewing
 * 24-hour fully programmable
 * 12-cup (5 ounces each) glass carafe
 * Brew Pause™ feature lets you enjoy a cup before brewing has finished
 * Adjustable auto-shutoff (0-4 hours) 
 * Grind-off feature
 * 1 to 4-cup feature
 * Gold tone commercial style permanent filter
 * Charcoal water filter removes impurities
 * Limited 3-year warranty



THE PERFECT CUP OF COFFEE
Element 1: Water
Coffee is 98% water. The quality of that water is as important as the quality of your coffee. If water doesn't taste good from the tap, it won't taste good in your coffee. That's why Cuisinart has added a water filter to the Grind & Brew Coffeemaker. The charcoal filter removes chlorine, bad tastes, and odors, for the purest coffee flavor, every time you brew. 

Element 2: Coffee
While coffee is 98% water, all of the flavor comes from the beans. To achieve the same great taste you enjoy at a coffee bar, you need to use the same quality of coffee. 

Buy the beans fresh and whole, only about two weeks' supply at a time for maximum freshness. Once the coffee bean is broken, its flavor degrades very quickly. That's why the Grind & Brew grinds your coffee just prior to brewing. If it is not practical to buy small supplies, separate larger amounts of beans into one to two week portions immediately after purchase, and freeze them in airtight containers. 

The best way to maximize freshness is to minimize exposure to air, light, and moisture. So, once beans have been removed from the freezer, maintain them in a sealed container at room temperature, since damaging condensation occurs every time the beans are removed from the freezer or refrigerator. Note that some coffee experts advise against freezing dark-roast beans, because freezing can cause the oils to coagulate. Other experts disagree. We suggest you experiment and decide for yourself.

Element 3: Grind
The grind is critical for proper flavor extraction. If the grind is too fine, over-extraction and bitterness will result. Too fine a grind may also clog the filter. If grind is too coarse, the water will pass through too quickly and the maximum flavor will not be extracted. The Grind & Brew is preset for a medium grind, the optimal grind for this type of coffeemaker. 

Element 4: Proportion
Coffee that is too strong or too weak is always a disappointment. Follow the recommended portions of ground coffee in the instructions included with every Grind & Brew, and later adjust the amount to suit your taste. The Grind & Brew makes up to twelve (12) 5-ounce cups of coffee
feature_bullets: 12-Cup automatic coffeemaker with built-in automatic bean grinder
Charcoal water filter and permanent gold tone filter ensures only the freshest coffee flavor flows through.
Includes measuring scoop and instruction booklet
Product built to North American Electrical Standards; NOTE: Check User manual in Technical Specification before use
Fully programmable with adjustable auto-shutoff from 0 to 4 hours, Brew Pause, 1- to 4-Cup setting, and grind-off option for using pre-ground coffee
